gratitude.title: Gratitude
gratitude.whatAreYouGratefulFor: What are you grateful for today?
gratitude.noEntries: You have no gratitude entries yet
gratitude.noEntriesForDate: No entries for the selected date
gratitude.noEntriesForToday: You haven't added anything to your list today yet
gratitude.entrySaved: Your gratitude entry has been saved
gratitude.loginRequired: You must log in to save entries
gratitude.scienceBacked: Gratitude practice has scientifically proven benefits
gratitude.benefit1: Improves emotional well-being and reduces depression
gratitude.benefit3: Increases resilience and ability to face challenges
gratitude.benefit4: Improves sleep quality and physical health
gratitude.practice1: Write 3 things you're grateful for each day
gratitude.practice2: Be specific: instead of "my family", write "my mother's supportive call today"
gratitude.practice3: Vary your gratitudes: look for new things each day
gratitude.practice4: Go deeper: explain why you're grateful for that
gratitude.practice5: Make it a habit: choose a specific time of day
gratitude.consistencyText: Studies show that practicing gratitude for 21 consecutive days can create lasting changes in your outlook and mental well-being.
gratitude.importanceDescription: Practicing gratitude shifts your focus from what's missing to what's present. Regular gratitude practice has been shown to improve mental health, strengthen relationships, and support long-term recovery.

checkIn.title: Daily Check-in
checkIn.question1: Did I stay clean from use today?
checkIn.question2: Did I encounter any situation that disturbed me today?
checkIn.question3: The most important thing to remind myself today is:
checkIn.question5: Was I in touch with my feelings today?
checkIn.question7: Did I follow my daily values?
checkIn.question8: Have you done something that you believe limits you instead of expanding you?
checkIn.question9: Have you had negative thoughts today?
checkIn.question10: Did you go to bed yesterday with a tidy house?
checkIn.question11: How would you rate your rest last night?
checkIn.question12: Have you eaten well in quantity and quality?
checkIn.question13: Do you think you've moved enough?
checkIn.question14: How many glasses of water have you had throughout the day?
checkIn.helpText: Daily check-ins help you maintain awareness of your emotional state and identify patterns in your recovery journey. All text responses will create a new entry in your journal.
checkIn.triggerPlaceholder: Tell your version of events without judging and how and where you felt it.
checkIn.triggerHelp: This description will be automatically saved as an entry in your journal with the title "Emotional Triggers"
checkIn.resentmentPlaceholder: What situation or person caused this resentment? How did it affect you?
checkIn.resentmentHelp: This description will be automatically saved as an entry in your journal with the title "Resentments"
checkIn.valuesPlaceholder: Which value have you been unfaithful to. How and why have you been unfaithful. How can you make amends.
checkIn.valuesHelp: This description will be automatically saved as an entry in your journal with the title "When I'm unfaithful to my values"
checkIn.limitingLabel: What obstacles need to be overcome?
checkIn.limitingPlaceholder: Describe the obstacles to overcome concretely
checkIn.negativeThoughtsPlaceholder: What negative thoughts did you have today?
checkIn.relapseDescription: Relapses are part of the process. What's important is learning from them.
checkIn.relapseAddictionLabel: In which addiction have you had the relapse?
checkIn.counterResetDescription: The counter for this addiction has been updated
checkIn.checkInSavedSuccess: Your daily progress has been recorded successfully
checkIn.loginRequiredError: You must log in to save check-in
checkIn.defaultPlaceholder: The best is yet to come

tour.welcome: Welcome! 👋 I'll show you the main features of the app. You can access the menu from the ☰ button in the top left corner.
tour.cleanTime: 🫀 Here you'll see your clean time and can manage your addictions.
tour.dailyProgress: 📊 Your Daily Progress: check-ins, completed goals, and reminders.
tour.goals: 🎯 Today's Goals: mark your daily objectives as completed.
tour.quickTools: 🛠️ Quick Access: quickly access your favorite tools.
tour.menu: 💡 Use the ☰ menu to explore all sections: Journal, Chat, Community, Tools and more.
tour.center: 🫀 Your Center: Here you'll find your daily summary, check-ins, and main statistics.
tour.planDesc: 🎯 My Plan: Create and manage your personalized recovery plan.
tour.progressDesc: 📈 Progress: Visualize your evolution and achievements over time. Create custom reports.
tour.emotionJournalDesc: 😊 Emotion Journal: Record how you feel each day.
tour.journalDesc: 📔 Journal: Write your thoughts and reflections freely.
tour.valuesDesc: ❤️ Values: Define and connect with your core values.
tour.chatDesc: 💬 Chat: Talk with your AI assistant and the community.
tour.communityDesc: 🫶 Community: Connect with others in recovery, share and find support.
tour.toolsDesc: 🛠️ Tools: Access useful resources for your recovery.
tour.helpDesc: 🆘 Help: Find immediate help when you need it.
tour.settingsDesc: ⚙️ Settings: Customize your experience and preferences.
tour.welcomeContent: This application supports you in your addiction recovery process. You'll find various tools to help you understand where you are, record your emotions, and understand which situations or people may be hindering your goals. You can activate up to 3 recovery processes, as many habits and substances are connected.
tour.anonymityContent: Anonymity is especially important to us. If you don't wish to select a specific dependency in the registry, you have the option to include "Addiction 1", "Addiction 2" and "Addiction 3". In chat areas, you can write in anonymous mode. All your information is encrypted under strict security protocols.
tour.scienceContent: We've included tools like daily check-ins, journal use, emotion diary, value lists, chats or mentorships with other community members, whose benefits are widely proven by science.
tour.planContent: The application loads a series of daily goals for your "Action Plan" by default. You can delete or edit the periodicity of tasks if you wish, although we strongly recommend that you try sticking only to these tasks for at least 40 days.
tour.emergencyContent: Our functionality contemplates the possibility of relapses. If in your daily check-in you answer "No" to the question "Did I stay clean from use today?", the option to write a "Relapse Inventory" will be activated for you to describe what situation or emotions led you to relapse. Remember that the goal is to learn from each process to gain greater capacity for action.
tour.reportsContent: In the "Progress" area you can generate AI-assisted psychotherapeutic reports that can help you understand your progress or the need to make changes to keep moving forward. These reports can also be useful for your therapist.

landing.subtitle: A comprehensive tool to support your process

quotes.1: It's always the simple that produces the marvelous.
quotes.3: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
quotes.4: Courage is not the absence of fear, but triumph over it.
quotes.5: Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day after day.
quotes.6: Don't count the days, make the days count.
quotes.7: Recovery is not a destination, it's a journey.
quotes.8: Every day is a new opportunity to start again.
quotes.9: Strength doesn't come from what you can do. It comes from overcoming the things you thought you couldn't do.
quotes.10: The first step doesn't get you where you want to go, but it gets you out of where you are.

reflections.1: Today I choose to move away from what harms me and closer to what heals me
reflections.2: My past doesn't define my future
reflections.3: Every day I stay clean is a victory
reflections.4: I have the power to choose my path
reflections.6: I am stronger than I think
reflections.7: I deserve a full and healthy life
reflections.8: Progress, not perfection, is my goal

defaultGoals.emotional1Description: Daily practice of meditation and visualization to strengthen your mental well-being
defaultGoals.emotional1Instructions: Find a quiet place, sit comfortably and spend 10-15 minutes meditating. Then visualize how you want your day to be.
defaultGoals.emotional1Notes: Consistency is key. Try to do it at the same time each day.
defaultGoals.emotional2Description: Record your daily emotions to identify patterns and work on your emotional well-being
defaultGoals.emotional2Instructions: At the end of the day, reflect on the emotions you experienced. Identify the main ones and their causes.
defaultGoals.emotional2Notes: Don't judge your emotions, simply observe and accept them.
defaultGoals.emotional3Description: Write a letter of gratitude to someone important in your life
defaultGoals.emotional3Instructions: Think of someone who has had a positive impact on your life. Write a letter expressing your gratitude specifically.
defaultGoals.emotional3Notes: You don't need to send the letter, the act of writing it is already therapeutic.
defaultGoals.relationships3Description: Recognize and celebrate your achievements, no matter how small they may seem
defaultGoals.relationships3Instructions: In the middle of the month, take a moment to reflect on your achievements. Share them with someone you trust.
defaultGoals.relationships3Notes: Celebrating doesn't mean becoming complacent, but recognizing your progress.
defaultGoals.practical1Description: A simple habit that sets a positive tone for the day
defaultGoals.practical1Instructions: When you get up, make your bed immediately. It only takes 2 minutes.
defaultGoals.practical1Notes: This small act of discipline creates momentum for the rest of the day.
defaultGoals.inventoryDescription: Daily reflection on your behavior and emotions
defaultGoals.inventoryInstructions: At the end of the day, reflect: What did I do well? What can I improve? How did I feel? Were there any risky situations?
defaultGoals.inventoryNotes: Be honest with yourself. This exercise is for you, not to judge yourself but to learn.

settings.restoreGoalsToDefault: Restore goals to their default settings and restart the abstinence counter. All your other data (check-ins, journals, contacts, etc.) will remain intact.
settings.thisWillRestoreGoals: This will restore your goals to default settings and restart the "I've been free for" counter. All your other data (check-ins, journals, contacts, etc.) will be kept. This action cannot be undone.
settings.goalsResetSuccessfully: Your goals have been restored to default settings and your counter has been restarted.
settings.thisActionIsPermanent: This action is permanent and cannot be undone. All your data will be permanently deleted.
settings.thisActionCannotBeUndone: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete your account and all your data from our servers.
settings.receiveNotificationsForCheckIn: Receive notifications to complete your daily check-in
